Wealth Management.title: Summarize a client’s portfolio review
Wealth Management.task: Write a prompt that asks an LLM to summarize a client's last quarter portfolio performance, highlight risk exposures, and propose 2 actionable rebalancing suggestions.

examples.input: Holdings: 40% equities (US large-cap), 40% bonds (IG), 20% cash. Q3 perf: +2.1%
examples.output: Q3 up +2.1% driven by US large-cap equities. Allocation 40/40/20 remains balanced; duration risk limited via IG bonds. Consider trimming overweight mega-cap growth and adding diversified dividends; redeploy cash into short-duration bonds to lock yields.

examples.input: Client risk: Moderate; Constraints: no energy sector >10%
examples.output: Client is moderate risk; maintain volatility controls. Keep energy below 10% by using broad equity exposures. Two actions: (1) increase investment-grade ladder by 5% for income stability, (2) add diversified factor ETF to reduce sector concentration.

test_cases.input: Holdings: 50% equities (US+EU), 35% bonds (IG/short), 15% cash. Q4 performance: +0.9%. Constraint: energy exposure <=8%.
test_cases.expected: Mentions +0.9% in Q4, current 50/35/15 mix, notes energy cap <=8%, highlights risks and gives 2 actionable rebalancing steps.

test_cases.input: Holdings: 35% equities (EM tilt), 45% bonds (IG long duration), 20% alts. Q1 performance: -1.3%. Risk: Moderate.
test_cases.expected: Summarizes -1.3%, cites EM equity and duration risk, proposes 2 rebalances (e.g., reduce duration, diversify EM) aligned to moderate risk.

test_cases.input: Holdings: 60% equities, 25% bonds, 15% cash. Q2 performance: +3.4%. Constraint: maintain cash >=10% for near-term needs.
test_cases.expected: States +3.4% with 60/25/15 mix, flags equity concentration risk, preserves cash >=10%, and lists 2 practical rebalancing suggestions.

Asset Management.title: ESG highlights generator
Asset Management.task: Create a prompt that turns raw KPI data into a concise ESG summary paragraph for a fund factsheet.

examples.input: Carbon intensity: -18% vs benchmark; Board diversity: 42%
examples.output: The fund’s carbon intensity is 18% below its benchmark, reflecting portfolio decarbonization. Board diversity at 42% supports improved governance and oversight.
We conducted 23 engagements focused on climate risk and labor standards. The strategy excludes issuers with >25% thermal-coal revenue, aligning with our transition policy.

test_cases.input: Scope 1+2 emissions: -12% YoY; Renewable share: 31%; Controversies: none material.
test_cases.expected: One concise paragraph noting -12% emissions YoY, 31% renewables, no material controversies, with clear ESG framing.

test_cases.input: Gender pay gap: -3pp vs last year; Supply-chain audits: 87% coverage; Water intensity: -9% YoY.
test_cases.expected: Concise paragraph covering pay gap improvement, 87% audit coverage, and water intensity progress.

test_cases.input: Independent directors: 64%; UNGC signatories: 78% holdings; Climate targets: 55% companies SBTi-aligned.
test_cases.expected: Summary highlighting governance strength (64% independent), UNGC breadth, and >50% SBTi alignment.

GOTO.title: Internal knowledge extraction
GOTO.task: Design a prompt that converts a long technical guidance document into a one-page cheat sheet with 6 numbered best-practices and a 2-sentence summary.

examples.input: Doc: 'Data access policy v4.1' ; Audience: junior analysts
examples.output: Summary (2 sentences) clarifying objective and scope. Then 6 numbered best-practices (least privilege, request workflow, logging, approval steps, data retention, escalation paths).

examples.input: Include quick action steps and references to sections
examples.output: Each best-practice includes an action verb (e.g., 'Request', 'Document') and a section reference (e.g., '§3.2').

test_cases.input: Document: 'ML Model Deployment Guide v2.0' Audience: new MLEs
test_cases.expected: 2-sentence summary plus exactly 6 numbered best-practices with concrete actions and brief references.

test_cases.input: Document: 'API Security Standards v1.5' Audience: internal developers
test_cases.expected: Cheat sheet with 2-sentence overview and 6 numbered practices touching auth, rate limits, secrets, logging, testing, incident response.

test_cases.input: Document: 'Data Retention Policy v3.0' Audience: ops
test_cases.expected: Two-sentence summary and six numbered items referencing sections, including retention periods and deletion workflows.

Global Markets.title: Market commentary brief
Global Markets.task: Write a prompt that asks an LLM to produce a 3-paragraph morning market commentary covering FX, rates, and equities with one trading idea per asset class.

examples.input: FX: USD strength; Rates: 10y yields +12bps; Equities: Tech leads
examples.output:
Para 1 (FX): USD firm on rate differentials; idea: fade EUR rallies via options.
Para 2 (Rates): 10y +12bps on supply; idea: duration hedge via futures.
Para 3 (Equities): Tech leads on AI; idea: rotate into quality growth with stops.

examples.input: Region: EMEA; Tone: concise, trading desk
examples.output: EMEA focus; clipped, desk-style prose; each paragraph ends with a crisp trade idea and risk.

test_cases.input: FX: GBP softer after CPI miss; Rates: Bund yields +8bps; Equities: banks outperform.
test_cases.expected: Three paragraphs, one each for FX/Rates/Equities, each including one concrete trade idea and risk note.

test_cases.input: FX: JPY whipsaws on BoJ chatter; Rates: UST curve flattens; Equities: cyclicals lag.
test_cases.expected: 3-paragraph format, short desk tone, each with a specific trade suggestion tied to the narrative.

test_cases.input: FX: EUR steady; Rates: Gilts pressured by supply; Equities: energy gains on oil pop.
test_cases.expected: Mentions all three with trade ideas; concise, EMEA-aware framing acceptable.

Global Banking.title: Deal teaser extraction
Global Banking.task: Craft a prompt to extract the 5 most compelling selling points from a deal teaser PDF, with bullet points capped at 20 words each.

examples.input: Sector: FinTech; Geography: APAC; Revenue: $120M; Growth: 35% YoY
examples.output:
• $120M revenue with 35% YoY growth
• APAC footprint with strong regulatory relationships
• Scalable platform with high-margin payments
• 200+ enterprise clients and 98% retention
• Proprietary fraud engine reducing false positives

examples.input: Differentiators: proprietary fraud engine; 200+ enterprise clients
examples.output:
• Proprietary fraud engine with proven accuracy
• Enterprise-scale client base (>200) and low churn

test_cases.input: Vertical SaaS; ARR $45M; NRR 130%; SOC2 Type II; expanding to EMEA; churn 3%.
test_cases.expected: Exactly 5 bullets, each ≤20 words, emphasizing ARR, NRR, security cred, growth (EMEA), and low churn.

test_cases.input: B2B payments; TPV $9B; take-rate 65 bps; 30 countries; partnerships with top-10 banks.
test_cases.expected: Five concise bullets capturing TPV, monetization (bps), global reach, and bank partnerships.

test_cases.input: AI fraud detection; Fortune 500 logos; modular APIs; payback <12 months; gross margin 76%.
test_cases.expected: Five bullets ≤20 words focusing on AI edge, logos, fast payback, high margins, modular APIs.

Global Research.title: Research summary for clients
Global Research.task: Design a prompt that converts a long research note into a client-friendly 5-bullet summary plus a 1-line investment implication.

examples.output:
• Demand stabilizing in datacenter and AI adjacencies
• Inventory normalization underway in PCs
• Foundry capex disciplined
• Pricing mixed; leaders hold share
• Watch China subsidy shifts
Implication: Favor quality semis with AI leverage.

examples.input: Audience: institutional investors; Style: clear, non-technical
examples.output: Bullets should avoid jargon and end with a single-line implication linking thesis to positioning.

test_cases.input: Report: European banks Q4 preview; Topics: NIM, capital returns, credit quality.
test_cases.expected: Five client-friendly bullets plus one-line implication addressing NIM, capital, and credit quality.

test_cases.input: Note: Global autos EV outlook; Topics: pricing, supply chain, incentives.
test_cases.expected: 5 bullets + 1 implication; clear language on pricing pressure, supply risk, incentives.

test_cases.input: Report: US housing update; Topics: mortgage rates, inventory, affordability.
test_cases.expected: 5 bullets + 1 implication; non-technical coverage of rates, supply, affordability.

Finance.title: KPI anomaly explorer
Finance.task: Create a prompt that asks an LLM to scan a list of monthly KPIs and highlight anomalies, probable causes, and two corrective actions.

examples.input: KPIs: Revenue -5% MoM; CAC +12% ; Churn stable
examples.output:
Anomalies: revenue -5%, CAC +12%.
Causes: weaker funnel conversion; paid mix shift.
Actions: tighten targeting and landing tests; shift budget to high-ROAS channels.

examples.input: Provide confidence level for each cause
examples.output: Include a confidence tag (High/Med/Low) for each hypothesized cause.

test_cases.input: MRR -2% MoM; ARPU flat; NPS -6pts; Refunds +30%; Trials +15%.
test_cases.expected: Calls out anomalies (NPS, refunds), gives probable causes each with confidence, lists two concrete corrective actions.

test_cases.input: Leads +20%; SQL rate -5pp; Win rate -2pp; Cycle +4 days.
test_cases.expected: Highlights conversion issues; proposes two actions (e.g., lead qual revamp, deal desk support) with rationale.

test_cases.input: Gross margin -1.8pp; COGS +3%; Utilization -4pp; Overtime +12%.
test_cases.expected: Identifies margin/COGS/utilization anomalies; suggests two corrective actions tied to ops and staffing.

Compliance.title: Policy Q&A author
Compliance.task: Write a prompt to convert a long internal policy into a Q&A with clear, compliance-friendly answers and citations to sections.

examples.input: Policy: Travel & Expenses v3.2; Sections 4, 7 most asked
examples.output: Q&A formatting with short answers and section citations (e.g., '§4.1').

examples.input: Audience: new hires; Tone: plain language
examples.output: Use plain language, avoid legalese, and cite the exact section for each answer.

test_cases.input: Policy: 'Code of Conduct v5.0' Focus: gifts, conflicts of interest.
test_cases.expected: Q&A list with cited sections for gifts and conflicts; plain, compliance-approved phrasing.

test_cases.input: Policy: 'Data Classification v2.3' Topics: labeling, handling restricted data.
test_cases.expected: Q&A with citations on labels and restricted handling; concise and clear.

test_cases.input: Policy: 'BYOD Policy v1.8' Topics: device security, incident reporting.
test_cases.expected: Q&A format, each answer cites sections; includes incident reporting steps.

Operations.title: Incident triage checklist
Operations.task: Design a prompt that turns an incident report into a triage checklist: immediate actions, stakeholders to notify, and a 3-step remediation plan.

examples.input: Incident: 'Backoffice batch job failed at 02:00; error 502'
examples.output:
Immediate: restart job, capture logs.
Notify: ops lead, app owner, SRE on-call.
Remediation: (1) root-cause logs, (2) fix retry policy, (3) add alert.
Checklist includes system owners and clear handoffs to affected platforms.

test_cases.input: Incident: API latency spiked to 2s at 09:15; 5xx at 3%; region: eu-west-1.
test_cases.expected: Checklist with immediate steps, stakeholder notifications, and 3-step remediation tied to latency/5xx in eu-west-1.

test_cases.input: Incident: Overnight ETL failed at step 4; missing S3 partition; downstream dashboards stale.
test_cases.expected: Immediate actions, notifications (data eng, BI), and 3-step remediation addressing S3 partition and retries.

test_cases.input: Incident: Payment queue backlog > 50k; consumer errors due to schema mismatch.
test_cases.expected: Triage lists actions, stakeholders, and 3-step fix plan for schema mismatch and backlog drain.
